title: Fort Raleigh National Historic Site: Calendar
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Calendar            Calendar        Ranger discussing an English coat of arms National Park Service       Ranger programs are available seasonally, spring through autumn. Use the search feature below to access the current schedule of ranger programs. You can also check out the park newspaper for the summer program schedule.          Keyword       By Date     Start Date      End Date          Search         Upcoming Events    Showing 6 results    Show ALL instances of recurring events   RSS Feed      Fort Raleigh National Historic Site For Kids: Create Your Own Coat of Arms      Time: 11:30 AM to 12:00 PM,5:30 PM to 6:00 PM Location: Earthen Fort Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 05/27/2016 to 09/05/2016 John White and the Roanoke Colony had their own unique Coat of Arms. Join us to learn about coats of arms and create your own. View Details      Fort Raleigh National Historic Site Insights and Images      Time: 3:00 PM to 3:30 PM Location: Visitor Center Theater Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 05/27/2016 to 09/05/2016 Are pictures worth a 1,000 words?  If so, what do those words tell us?  View Details      Fort Raleigh National Historic Site One Island Many Stories!      Time: 4:00 PM to 4:30 PM Location: Meet at the Earthen Fort Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 05/27/2016 to 09/05/2016 Since before the English first set foot on Roanoke Island in 1584, the island has seen many people come and go. View Details      Fort Raleigh National Historic Site The Lost Colony?      Time: 11:00 AM to 11:30 AM Location: Meet at the Earthen Fort Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 05/27/2016 to 09/05/2016 Join us as we explore the history and mystery surrounding England's first attempt to colonize the New World. View Details      Fort Raleigh National Historic Site One Island Many Stories!      Time: 2:00 PM to 2:30 PM Location: Earthen Fort Fees: Free     Tuesday, August 16, 2016 Every Tuesday Weekly & Every Wednesday Weekly & Every Thursday Weekly  from 05/31/2016 to 09/01/2016 Since before the English first set foot on Roanoke Island in 1584, the island has seen many people come and go. View Details      Fort Raleigh National Historic Site The Lost Colony?      Time: 5:00 PM to 5:30 PM Location: Meet at the Earthen Fort Fees: Free     Tuesday, August 16, 2016 Every Tuesday Weekly & Every Wednesday Weekly & Every Thursday Weekly  from 05/31/2016 to 09/01/2016 The colonial ambitions of the English in the late 16th century and their explorations of the "New World" forever changed the history of Roanoke Island.
